Text:
(The main rounds of the Bushin Festival kick off with
the start of the new week.)
(Claire went ahead of me to the venue.)

(So I'm here with the ticket she gave me, trying to
find my seat.)

(I get to a place that makes me think, "No way could
it be here," so I check with the clerk at the door.)
(...and it turns out, yes way, it is here.)

(I'm shown inside with extreme courtesy, but once in,
I instantly want to leave.)

These aren't just any reserved seats... These are the
hyper-VIP seats.

(Damn, I should've at least worn my academy uniform.
This is no place for side characters. I'll just find the
right moment to fade out and...)
Are you certain you wish to sit here?
Yes, it is important that I interact with my juniors.
Hm?
You are...?

(The usher leads me to a seat that happens to be
right next to a member of the royal family.)

My name is Cid Kagenou. And it would appear I am at
the wrong seat.
I perform a crisp about-face and attempt to leave.

Kagenou? Ah, Claire's brother. You were involved in
that incident as well...
...You know my sister?

Yes. We've met several times when she came to train
with our order. In fact, she intends to join us once
she finishes her studies.

Also, this is the correct seat. That ticket's from
Claire, isn't it?
(Princess Iris's smile is so sincere it hurts.)
If you don't mind then...

Now then, Cid Kagenou. I know this is long overdue,
but I am sorry for the trouble we put you through
regarding Zenon Griffey.
Oh, please think nothing of it...

The kingdom has already spoken of the incident with
your family,

but please accept my personal apology as Alexia's
sister.
...Thank you.

(As an extra, the last thing I want is a named
character bowing her head to me in a place
like this.)
I hope that you will continue to remain her friend.

I don't know if I would call us friends. More like
I just pick up the coins she throws my way.
The coins she throws your way?

Like when you toss a stick and get your dog to fetch
it.
So you two played with a dog?
It wasn't so much playing WITH a dog...
I mean that I WAS the... Ah, never mind.

Well, I know she is pleased she made such a good
friend.
Oh, I wouldn't be so sure.

You know, Alexia was supposed to be here today, but
she suddenly said she didn't want to come. I'm very
sorry about that.
Oh, no, no, no. Please don't worry about it.

Which contestant do you have your eyes on this year,
Princess Iris?
I am curious to know as well.

All of the participants gathered here today interest
me, but if I had to name one in particular...

it would be Annerose, formerly of Velgalta's Seven
Blades.

Many of the faces here in the final rounds of the
festival are familiar to me, but this year marks
her first appearance.

I've seen Lady Annerose fight, and she is quite
formidable. I would not stand a chance against her...

I saw her as well. But I have no doubt it is
Princess Iris who will be victorious.

There has been a great deal of criticism of the Royal
Bushin method, but if you were to emerge as champion,
why...
Hey now, don't pressure her like that.
That wasn't what I—

It's fine. I was always planning to win. I'm prepared
to carry the weight of the Royal Bushin method, and
this very country, on my back.
Um, is there anyone else who's piqued your interest?
By the way, who is he?

He's a student at the academy, no? Remember, he was
in the Royal Bushin section 1 class in a white uniform.
Oh, I remember now.
He's Princess Alexia's boyfriend...
He is Cid Kagenou. Claire's younger brother.
What?!
He and Claire are very close, as it happens.
See, I knew it was him.
Shh!

I...see. Well, you may not share your sister's skill
with a sword, but setting your sights too high won't
get you anywhere, so I do hope you stay grounded.

Indeed. Keep at it with what you have. Do not make
the mistake of being overly ambitious or seeking to
marry beyond your station.
Thank...you.

Now, Princess Iris, is there anyone else who's piqued
your interest? Say, for instance, Annerose's opponent
in the first round...
...Mundane Mann?
This is his debut appearance as well.

Mundane... I have yet to see one of his matches,
so I'm afraid I can't say either way.

Oh, I saw him. He was fast, but that's all I can say
about him. His stance was that of a rank amateur.

The likes of him does not belong in this competition.
He is all luck and impetus with no skill whatsoever.
(So they've deemed Mundane a two-bit nobody, eh?)

(Ohhh yeah, that means I've got complete control over
how people perceive him.)

Oh, and there is one other person I'm keeping tabs
on, though she is not in the listings.

Apparently, the winner of the first Bushin Festival,
the elf swordmaster hailed as the War Goddess, is
here in the capital.
An elf swordmaster... You don't mean―?!

But she hasn't made a public appearance in over a
decade...!

Every single participant in the tournament is taking
careful note of her actions.
Beatrix...

(I had her pegged as pretty tough, but sounds like
she's a real big shot.)
Is something wrong?
Oh, I just need to go powder my nose.

(It's almost match time, so I use hitting the can as
an excuse to rush off to the locker room.)
(Hm?)
(...I sense someone powerful.)

(Two heavyweights crossing paths is the perfect setup
to trade some badass quips. The only problem is I'm
in background character mode now...)
Cid.
Ack! Oh, um, you're...
Beatrix.
Yeah, that's it, Beatrix.
Are you ignoring me?
Not at all.
You aren't?
I'm not.
Really?
Really.
I see.
Yeah.

Have you seen any elves that look like me since we
last met?
Nope, no sign of any elves that look like you.
I see.

This place draws many people, so I thought perhaps I
could find her here.

True, it is a super popular sword-fighting
tournament.
So...what're all those?
I bought them.
I see.
I bought too many of them.
That does look like an awful lot.
You can have one.
Thanks.
Okay, then I'll give you this in return.
Here.
Thanks.
See ya later.
See ya later.
